Lu Siwei and Ren Quanniu, family-commissioned lawyers of 2 of the 12 Hongkongers, are not in danger of being disqualified by the provincial Departments of Justice, as a revenge by the state for their involvement in the case of the 12 and other human right cases, including that of civil journalist Zhang Zhan.
Lu and Ren have been working on human right cases in China for years, and the case of the Twelve has been the last straw on the camel’s back. Overcoming various difficulties over the years, both Lu and Ren deemed the legal profession as their lifelong pursuit. If they are disqualified, they would no longer be able to serve as a lawyer in mainland China, and their lifelong passion is denied.
Lu and Ren have provided invaluable help to the 12 Hongkongers and are now being punished for it. Hongkongers and the world cannot stay silent. We urge you to express your support for Lu and Ren to their respective provincial Department of Justices.

Lu Siwei and Ren Quanniu, family-commissioned lawyers of 2 of the 12 Hongkongers, are not in danger of being disqualified by the provincial Departments of Justice, as a revenge by the state for their involvement in the case of the 12 and other human right cases, including that of civil journalist Zhang Zhan.
Lu and Ren have been working on human right cases in China for years, and the case of the Twelve has been the last straw on the camel’s back. Overcoming various difficulties over the years, both Lu and Ren deemed the legal profession as their lifelong pursuit. If they are disqualified, they would no longer be able to serve as a lawyer in mainland China, and their lifelong passion is denied.
Lu and Ren have provided invaluable help to the 12 Hongkongers and are now being punished for it. Hongkongers and the world cannot stay silent. We urge you to express your support for Lu and Ren to their respective provincial Department of Justices.
